snippet: The pianist Yefim Bronfman took on the technical challenges of Magnus Lindberg’s Piano Concerto No. 2 on Thursday night at Avery Fisher Hall.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews premiere of classical music work by Finnish composer Magnus Lindberg, performed by the New York Philharmonic with pianist Yefim Bronfman, at Avery Fisher Hall. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: The Finnish composer Magnus Lindberg is also a skilled pianist. So he is not one of those composers who write demanding piano works without really understanding the degree of difficulty. Mr. Lindberg absolutely knew that his Piano Concerto No. 2 would present awesome technical challenges for the soloist. But he also knew that the virtuoso pianist Yefim Bronfman had been lined up by the conductor Alan Gilbert and the New York Philharmonic for its premiere, which took place on Thursday night at Avery Fisher Hall, a night after Mr. Gilbert conducted the Philharmonic in Mahler's Sixth Symphony at Carnegie Hall.

headline.main: Composer's Parting Gift Is One to Remember
